author: parithosh
content:
New analysis drop for devnet-10: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/dencun-devnet-10-latency-analysis

We switched the blobber action to add a latency of 2s to 10% of blobs on the network before gossiping them. 

There are some outliers we're yet to isolate, i.e, blobs being delayed when they're at the epoch transition seem to have an outsized effect. There are some unexplained spikes we still need to look into - Head vote rate seems to drop at random epochs by ~10% before recovering. Let us know if any other data is interesting.

author: marioevz
content:
Hey, could someone from lighthouse help me debug these two logs?

Bootnode, 1st node:
https://hiveinterop.ethdevops.io/viewer.html?suiteid=1698663982-f5c4e8ca3c222ae48e955cea412272ab.json&suitename=eth2-deneb-testnet&testid=1&file=%2Fresults%2Flighthouse-bn_deneb%2Fclient-5e5439a2c9f831164897c5df83ce62bb053f012cbc9c47cad4b974a29b176151.log

Second node:
https://hiveinterop.ethdevops.io/viewer.html?suiteid=1698663982-f5c4e8ca3c222ae48e955cea412272ab.json&suitename=eth2-deneb-testnet&testid=1&file=%2Fresults%2Flighthouse-bn_deneb%2Fclient-6663ece06d1b8e35a812fe338aae6046c75714b43cbbccda15a2e7dc3f4a3fcf.log

It seems like hive test cases are randomly failing in a similar pattern where the second node refuses to add the first client (bootnode and trusted peer) because of an `ENR banned by table filter` error.
I'm not sure what this error means

author: marioevz
content: Thanks, let me try this, it's never reproduced locally so we'll have to wait for the hiveinterop.ethdevops.io run
